1
2module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Clause
3  ( -- * Token clause
4    TokenClause,
5    tokenClauses,
6
7    -- * Token line
8    TokenLine,
9    toks,
10    tokenLines, tokenLinesBz,
11    tokenLinesBzTextAssert,
12    isShortPrefix,
13  
14    -- * Examples
15    -- $Examples
16  ) where
17
18import qualified Data.Char                              as Ch
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol          as S
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Nipper    as S
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Rel       as S
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Section   as S
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Token     as S
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Utility   as S
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Message           as Msg
27
28
29-- --------------------------------------------  Token clause
30
31type TokenClause = B.CodeClause S.Token
32
33-- | Convert token lines into token clauses
34tokenClauses :: [TokenLine] -> [TokenClause]
35tokenClauses = map clause . split where
36    clause ls = B.CodeClause ls $ list ls
37
38    list :: [TokenLine] -> [S.Token]
39    list = concatMap $ S.sweepToken . B.lineTokens
40
41    split :: [TokenLine] -> [[TokenLine]]
42    split = B.gather B.splitClause . map indent . B.omit blank
43
44    blank :: TokenLine -> Bool
45    blank = all S.isBlankToken . B.lineTokens
46
47    indent :: TokenLine -> (Int, TokenLine)
48    indent = B.lineIndentPair tokenIndent
49
50tokenIndent :: S.Token -> Int
51tokenIndent (S.TSpace _ n) = n
52tokenIndent _ = 0
53
54
55-- --------------------------------------------  Token line
56
57-- | Token list on a line.
58type TokenLine = B.CodeLine S.Token
59
60-- | Split string into list of tokens.
61--   Result token list does not contain newline characters.
62tokens :: B.NIOPoint -> S.InputText -> [S.Token]
63tokens nio cs = concatMap B.lineTokens $ tokenLines nio cs
64
65-- | Abbreviated tokenizer.
66toks :: S.InputText -> [S.Token]
67toks s = tokens (B.nioFrom $ B.stringBz s) s
68
69-- | Tokenize text.
70tokenLines :: B.NIOPoint -> S.InputText -> [TokenLine]
71tokenLines = tokenLinesWith S.scanRel
72
73-- | Tokenize lazy bytestring.
74tokenLinesBz :: B.NIOPoint -> B.Bz -> [TokenLine]
75tokenLinesBz = tokenLinesBzWith S.scanRel
76
77-- | Tokenize lazy bytestring.
78tokenLinesBzTextAssert :: B.NIOPoint -> B.Bz -> [TokenLine]
79tokenLinesBzTextAssert = tokenLinesBzWith S.scanTextAssert
80
81tokenLinesWith :: S.Scanner -> B.NIOPoint -> S.InputText -> [TokenLine]
82tokenLinesWith scan = B.codeScanUp $ scan changeSection
83
84tokenLinesBzWith :: S.Scanner -> B.NIOPoint -> B.Bz -> [TokenLine]
85tokenLinesBzWith scan = B.codeScanUpBz $ scan changeSection
86
87changeSection :: S.ChangeSection
88changeSection name =
89    case name of
90      "rel"      -> just S.scanRel
91      "note"     -> just S.scanNote
92      "end"      -> just S.scanEnd
93      "license"  -> just S.scanLicense
94      "local"    -> unsupp "local section"
95      "attr"     -> unsupp "attr section"
96      "text"     -> unsupp "text section"
97      "doc"      -> unsupp "doc section"
98      "data"     -> unsupp "data section"
99      _          -> Nothing
100    where
101      just scan   = Just $ B.codeChange $ scan changeSection
102      unsupp n    = Just $ sectionUnsupported n
103
104sectionUnsupported :: String -> S.TokenScanMap
105sectionUnsupported msg r@B.CodeScan { B.codeInput = cs } = B.codeUpdate "" tok r where
106    tok  = S.unknownToken cp cs $ Msg.unsupported msg
107    cp   = B.codeInputPt r
108
109-- | Test string is short prefix.
110isShortPrefix :: B.Test String
111isShortPrefix  = all Ch.isAlpha
112
113
114-- ------------------------------------------------------------------
115-- $Examples
116--
117--  Words and quotations.
118--
119--  >>> toks $ unlines ["aa", "'bb'", "\"cc\""]
120--  [ TText <I0-L1-C0> TextRaw "aa"
121--  , TText <I0-L2-C0> TextQ "bb"
122--  , TText <I0-L2-C3> TextQ ""
123--  , TText <I0-L3-C0> TextQQ "cc" ]
124--
125--  Judgement.
126--
127--  >>> toks "|-- R  /a A0 /b 31"
128--  [ TText <I0-L1-C0> TextBar "|--", TSpace <I0-L1-C3> 1
129--  , TText <I0-L1-C4> TextRaw "R", TSpace <I0-L1-C5> 2
130--  , TTermN <I0-L1-C7> EQ "a", TSpace <I0-L1-C9> 1
131--  , TText <I0-L1-C10> TextRaw "A0", TSpace <I0-L1-C12> 1
132--  , TTermN <I0-L1-C13> EQ "b", TSpace <I0-L1-C15> 1
133--  , TText <I0-L1-C16> TextRaw "31" ]
134--
135--  Brackets.
136--
137--  >>> toks "aa (bb x y (z))"
138--  [ TText <I0-L1-C0> TextRaw "aa"
139--  , TSpace <I0-L1-C2> 1
140--  , TOpen <I0-L1-C3> "("
141--    , TText <I0-L1-C4> TextRaw "bb", TSpace <I0-L1-C6> 1
142--    , TText <I0-L1-C7> TextRaw "x", TSpace <I0-L1-C8> 1
143--    , TText <I0-L1-C9> TextRaw "y", TSpace <I0-L1-C10> 1
144--    , TOpen <I0-L1-C11> "("
145--      , TText <I0-L1-C12> TextRaw "z"
146--    , TClose <I0-L1-C13> ")"
147--  , TClose <I0-L1-C14> ")" ]
148--
149--  A comment.
150--
151--  >>> toks $ unlines ["abc ** this is a comment", "def",""]
152--  [ TText <I0-L1-C0> TextRaw "abc", TSpace <I0-L1-C3> 1
153--  , TComment <I0-L1-C4> " this is a comment"
154--  , TText <I0-L2-C0> TextRaw "def" ]
155--
